title: BambooHR API Integration
body:
Papaya API Integration with BambooHR

 

1. What is the integration? 

Papaya Global’s API integration with BambooHR allows users to sync payroll employee HR and PTO data from BambooHR to Papaya global. 

The integration supports both HR and PTO data; users may choose whether to integrate only HR data or both HR and PTO data.
HR Data SyncPTO Sync
New projects will be added to the daily HR data sync
HR Data from BambooHR to Papaya Global will sync daily
 
The daily data sync only retrieves HR Data for current onboarded projects
  • PTO data sync will run on the Salary Cutoff date
  • The first PTO sync will retrieve data for the preceding 3 months
  • Data that already exists in the Papaya platform will be skipped in the sync process
  • PTO records with future dates will not be synced
  • Only PTO records with an "Approved" status will be synced
 

2. Configuring BambooHR for API Integration

Before configuring a BambooHR API integration in Papaya Global, set up BambooHR:
  1. Choose an Identifier Field for Papaya Employees
  2. Configure mandatory employee Location field
  3. Create a Custom Access Level in BambooHR
  4. Assign the custom level to a dedicated Papaya user
  5. Populate mandatory fields in BambooHR for Papaya Global employees

2.1 Choose an Identifier Field for Papaya Employees

The data synchronization process requires that the Papaya platform identify which BabmooHR employees are Papaya Payroll employees. Use one of the following fields to identify Papaya Employees in the system:
 
  • Location
  • Division
  • Department
  • Employment Status
  • Job Title
 
Following configuration, populate this field for all current and new employees using parameters that will enable you to identify Papaya emolyees. The field must be mandatory for new Papaya employees.

2.2 Create a Custom Field to Map to Papaya Global's projects

A custom field is required for Papaya to associate employees with their projects.
A project in Papaya consists of 4 attributes:
  1. Site Location – Country
  2. Employee Service Type – Payroll, Contractor or EOR
  3. Pay Cycle – Monthly, Weekly, Semi-Monthly, Bi-Weekly
  4. Currency – USD/EUR/GBP…
e.g., Pragma Project 1 – Italy, Payroll, Monthly, EUR
Pragma Project 2 – UK, Payroll, Monthly, GBP
The custom field can be a pay group id, pay group name, legal entity ID or name, but it must reflect a 1:1 association to a project in Papaya.
In the initial setup of the integration, we will map your employees to the associated projects.

2.3 Create a Custom Access Level in BambooHR

To support the Papaya Global integration, you need to create a custom Access Level for your BambooHR user, by taking the following steps:
 
  1. Log into BambooHR with an Administrator level user. Select Settings> Access Levels, then click on the Customize icon, and choose Custom Access Level.
  2. The Custom Level Access dialog will open. In the Basic Info tab, enter the access level name and click Next Step.
  3. Skip the What this Access Level Can Do step by clicking Next Step
  4.  In the What this Access Level Can See tab – click All Employees, and select Only Some Employees from the drop-down menu.
  5. The Filter Options dialog will open. User the unique field you selected to choose only Papaya Payroll employees, then click Save.
  6. The What This Access Level Can See tab will open once again. Scroll down the page to view the Employee Data Filter viewing options:

  7. Click on each of the Employee Data Filter tabs (Personal, Job, Time Off, Documents,  Benefits, Training, Assets, and Emergency), and select View Only access.
  8. After configuring View Only permissions in all the data filter tabs, scroll down the page, and click Save & Finish.

2.4 Create a Dedicated Papaya User in BambooHR

After configuring the custom field and access level:
  1. Log into BambooHR as an Administrator.
  2. Create a Non-Employee user.
  3. Assign the Papaya custom access level to this user.
The dedicated user must have a valid email.

2.5 Populate Mandatory Fields in BambooHR

To enable BambooHR to communicate with Papaya Global and integrate HR and PTO data, some fields in BambooHR must be populated for every Papaya Global employee in BambooHR.
 
The following tables specify which fields are relevant to the Papaya Global integration, and which are mandatory and must be populated.
 
In addition to the following, you must ensure that BambooHR has a field that uniquely identifies Papaya Payroll employees, and a location field that supports the format required by Papaya Global.
 
Employee Basic Information Fields:
 
Employee Contact Details Fields:
 
Employee Employment Status Fields:
 
Employee Job Information Fields:
 
Employee Compensation Fields:
 
Employee PTO Data Fields:

3. Configuring Integration in Papaya Global

After configuring BambooHR for API integration with Papaya Global, you can proceed to configure the integration on the Papaya Global Integration Center. For a detailed explanation on accessing the Papaya Global Integration Center, click here .
Note: Only these users can access, view, and use the Integration Center (IC): Customer Admin, Customer HR Manager, Customer Read Only User, users with Org Level Access.
To configure a BambooHR API  integration take the following steps:
  1. Log out of BambooHR
  2. Select integration & integration type
  3. Connect to BambooHR
  4. Apply mapping schema
  5. Configure Auto-sync settings
  6. View integration status

3.1 Log out of BambooHR

To prevent SSO issues, log out of BambooHR prior to logging into Papaya to initiate the integration process.

3.2 Select Integration & Integration Type

To initiate the BambooHR API integration and begin the configuration process, click on BambooHR Application  in the Integration Center home page:
 
 
The Integration Details page will open, prompting you to select an integration type - HR or PTO. Click the Connect to BambooHR button next to the integration you wish to implement: HR or PTO
 
Note: Click on the more details links in the integration dialog for information on mandatory fields, required custom field configuration, and more.

3.3 Connect to BambooHR

The Subdomain dialog will open. Enter your BambooHR subdomain, then click Connect & Continue:
 
Note: The subdomain is the first part of your BambooHR domain. If your domain is https://companyname.bamboohr.com your subdomain is companyname.
You will be prompted to login to BambooHR. Click Login with Email and Password, and use the login credentials of the dedicated BambooHR user you created:
 
 
You may be prompted to confirm that your browser is trusted. This is a one-time confirmation request. Click Yes, Trust this Browser:
 

3.4 Apply Field Mapping Schema

The application enables you to map source data from your BambooHr system to target Papaya Global fields. You can create any number of schemas, and apply them to additional connections. 
 
This section explains how to apply an existing schema as-is. For detailed instructions on configuring, editing, and managing mapping schemas, click here.
Following connection to BambooHR, the Field Mapping page will open, displaying the default mapping schema:
 
 
Click the arrow next to the Mapping Names field and select schema from drop-down list:
 
 
Click Change to approve application of selected schema:
 
 
The selected schema will be applied. Click Connect & Continue:
 

3.5 Configure Auto-Sync Settings

Once fields have been mapped and a connection established, configure Auto-Sync settings:
 
Auto SyncHR DataPTO Data
Enabled
HR data will be automatically synced every day.
New projects will be automatically added to the auto-sync. 
Auto-sync will attempt to sync all Papaya workers; some updates may fail due to validation/other issues.
Data will be automatically updated on the same date as the Salary Update to ensure it pulls all approved requests for the next payroll cutoff.
DisabledYou will be directed to contact your dedicated CSM to implement manual synchronization to update HR data.You will be directed to contact your dedicated CSM to implement manual synchronization to update PTO data.
After setting Auto-Sync, click the Complete Integration button:
 
 

3.6 View Integration Status

Once you have completed configuring a PTO/HR integration, the integration center main page and the BambooHR integration dialog will provide the relvant indication:
 
 

4. Managing Mapping Schemas

4.1 Default Schema

Following connection to BambooHR, the Field Mapping page will open, displaying the default HR or PTO data mapping from the BambooHR source fields to Papaya Global target fields:
 
The default schema cannot be deleted or edited. There is no delete option for the schema, and any edits made to mapping while the default schema is applied can only be saved under a new name.

4.2 General Actions

4.2.1 Enabling Schema Editing

To enable schema editing, select and apply a schema from the schema drop-down, then confirm change. The schema will open in view mode. Click Edit Mapping to enter edit mode:

 
OR open schema drop-down, and click the edit icon next to the schema you want to edit. You will be asked to confirm schema change, then the schema will open in edit mode:
 
 
The default schema does not have an edit icon, as it cannot be changed. 

4.2.2 Deleting Schemas

To delete a schema, open the schema drop-down list, click the Delete icon next to the schema you want to delete, and confirm action:
 
 
The default schema does not have a delete edit icon, as it cannot be deleted.

4.2.3 Creating New Schemas

New schemas are created by applying changes to an existing schema, then saving the changed map under a new name.
 
To create a new schema, enable editing to the schema you want to use as a base, apply changes to mapping fields, then enter a unique name in the Mapping Name field:
 
 
Save the new schema:
If your base schema was the default map, click Save as New
If you selected another base schema, click the Save button arrow, then select Save as New:
 
If any of the mandatory fields are not mapped, the Save action will be disabled, and a tooltip will indicate the issue:
 

4.2.4 Saving Changes to Schema

Changes can be made to all schemas except the default map. If you apply changes to the default map, you can either save it as a new schema or discard the changes.
 
To apply changes to a schema, enable editing to the schema you want to edit, apply changes to mapping fields, then click the Save button:
 
If any of the mandatory fields are not mapped, the Save action will be disabled, and a tooltip will indicate the issue:
 

4.3 Editing Mapping

4.3.1 Editing Source/Target Fields

Enable editing for the schema you want to use as base for the new schema, then click on relevant tab to view current mapping schema:
 
 
Fields can only be mapped once. To change mapping of target fields (e.g map BambooHR Preferred Name field to Papaya First Name field) you must first disconnect existing mapping by selecting Do Not Map this Field - then configure the new connection:
 
 
 

4.3.2 Adding Custom Fields

Custom fields can only be added when configuring HR data integration
Enable editing for the schema where you want to add a custom field, open Custom Fields tab, then click Add Field:
 
 
Map custom field/s to Papaya target fields:
 

4.3.3 Field Transformation - Split

To apply the Split transformation to source data, enable editing to the schema, navigate to the field you wish to configure, then click the transformation icon next to the relevant field:
 
 
In the field transformation dialog, select split transformation type, then choose delimiter:
Click Split Fields, then map source field to target fields. System default is two (2) target fields. use the Add Field button to configure additional target fields for the split data:
Click Apply to save configuration. The main mapping page will show a transformation indicator (green check-mark) next to the relevant field:
To remove the transformation, click on the transformation icon to open the transformation dialog, then click Remove Transformation:
After a transformation is removed, the field will be unmapped:

4.3.4 Field Transformation - Lookup
To apply the Lookup transformation to source data, enable editing to the schema, navigate to the field you wish to configure, then click the transformation icon next to the relevant field:
In the field transformation dialog, select Lookup transformation type, then choose lookup table:
In the field transformation dialog, select Lookup, then choose the lookup table. Use the Add New link to configure a new lookup table:
Click Apply to save configuration. The main mapping page will show a transformation indicator (green check-mark) next to the relevant field:
To remove the transformation, click on the transformation icon to open the transformation dialog, then click Remove Transformation:
After a transformation is removed, the field will be unmapped:


5.  Managing BambooHR Integrations

5.1  Active/Draft Integrations

If you exit the integration wizard prior to completing integration by any means - closing the browser window, opening another Papaya page, etc. - your integration will be saved in Draft status, allowing you to complete the configuration process at any time:
Draft integrations are indicated in orange, and active integrations in green.

5.2  Editing an Active Integration (Delete/Auto-Sync)

You can only disconnect or change Auto-Sync settings in an active integration.
To edit integrations, access the integration centre as explained above, then set the Integrations toggle to My Integrations to display configured integrations.
My Integrations page displays Active Integrations (i.e. integrations that have been fully configured and are operational) and Draft Integrations (i.e. integrations that have been partially configured and are not yet operational).
Click on an active integration to open the integration dialog for editing:
Click on the context menu to Disconnect the connection, or Disable/Enable Auto-Sync:


5.3  Completing a Draft Integration

To complete a draft integration, access the integration centre , then set the Integrations toggle to My Integrations to display configured integrations.

My Integrations page displays Active Integrations (i.e. integrations that have been fully configured and are operational) and Draft Integrations (i.e. integrations that have been partially configured and are not yet operational).

Click on a draft integration to complete to open the integration dialog, then click Complete Setup to return to the step in which you closed the integration wizard:
To configure custom fields integration, click Edit Mapping, then click the Custom Fields tab:

Expensify Onboarding Process

The following table breaks down the steps required to implement Expensify data integration:
 
Expense Category Note:
Where a breakdown of different types of expenses is required for taxation purposes (mileage, per-diem, phone etc.) the expense policy defined on Expensify must utilize the relevant expense categories.
Currency Note:
  • Typically, Papaya retrieves expenses in a single currency for each project.
  • The currency will usually be identical to the Papaya project payment currency. A different currency can be configured via Papaya Support.
  • If an employee reports in multiple currencies, conversion must be implemented in Expensify (exchange rate + expense date), so that the reported expense payment retrieved by Papaya will be in the employee’s payment currency.
The following flowchart illustrates the integration process:
 

Ongoing Implementation

Note: Manual expense updates in Papaya are blocked for projects that are synced with Expensify to avoid data regression.

title: HCM Cloud Connector Setup
body:
Papaya Global's HCM cloud connector provides a file mapping tool that allows you to upload one or more Excel or CSV file templates.
The mapping wizard aligns and transforms uploaded data to meet the fields of the platform.
More information about the file upload security can be found here .
To use the data sync option you must go through these 3 steps:

  1. Prerequisites
  2. Approve the Mapping
  3. Create an SFTP folder for future uploads

 


PPP

Prerequisites

Preparing Your Data for Integration 

Key Data Requirements: 

  • Ensure source files from the customer meet format criteria: Excel (.xlsx) or CSV (.csv), and UTF-8 encoding. 
    • In an Excel (.xlsx) file, the table must start in column A.
    • In a  CSV (.csv) file, the sheet can contain only the table with the data and no additional unrelated data. 
  • Data Organization - the data can be organized in two formats:
    • Columns - each worker can appear only once in the file and each data field should be in a separate column. 
    • NEW - Multi-row in an Excel file (.xlsx) - each worker can appear multiple times in the file, one column can have different types of data, when using this option, you must also have a value column for each data type. You can see examples of the multi-row format here.
  • File, Sheet, and Header Consistency: 
    • File Name: The name should have no spaces in it. 
    • Sheet Name:
    • There are 2 options for sheet selection in case there is more than one sheet in the file. By default, the first sheet in the file will be mapped
      • By order - the sheet can be detected by it's location in the file (e.g., first sheet, second sheet etc.), if you choose this option, the location of the sheet in the file must remain the same. 
      • By name - the sheet can be mapped according to name:
        • Name - the sheet will remain in the same name
        • partial name - if you choose a word from the sheet name, make sure that this word does not appear in other sheets in the file
    • Header Location: The location of the header row in the file must stay the same. 
    • First Row of Data: The position of the first row of data should be consistent across files. 
    • Unique Header Column Names: Ensure that each column in the header has a unique name. No two columns should have the same name to avoid confusion and ensure precise data mapping. 
    • Exact Match for Header Column Names: The names of the header columns must match exactly with those specified in the template or mapping. This exact match is crucial for the system to correctly identify and process each data field. 
  • Consistency in Date Format Fields: 
    • Individual Column Consistency: Within each column that contains date fields, the date format must be consistent. Ensure that all date entries in a single column follow the same date format. 
    • Variability Across Different Fields: It is acceptable for different date fields (i.e., different columns) to have different date formats. However, within each specific column, the format should not vary. 
    • Standardize numeric formats across files. 
    • Ensure text format is consistent (no emojis or symbols) and avoid merged cells. 
    • Consistency in these aspects is essential as any changes may prevent the system from recognizing the file and its corresponding mapping. 
  • Each file can be created as a mapping in one of two options: A file that enables creation of workers and a file that updates existing workers only.
  • Files that will be used for creation of workers must have the following fields. 
    • Unique worker ID. 
    • First and last names. 
    • Hire date. 
    • At least one email (work or home).
  • Files that will be used to update data for existing workers:
    • Unique worker ID. 

Each worker has a main Worker ID (usually created in your HRIS system), in case you are using another system that generates different IDs, we can store an additional Worker ID on our platform, this enables you to send data directly from that platform with the ID that is used there. 

Adhering to these technical requirements will facilitate a smooth and error-free data integration process. If you have any questions or need assistance in preparing your file, please contact your Papaya Customer Success Manager. 

 

Fields 

In this article you can see which fields are relevant for the Papaya connection, and which are mandatory and must be populated.  

PPP


Approve the mapping

Once the file was mapped you can approve the mapping. 
In the Integrations section go to Integrations and choose Data Imports. Here you can see all the data that was synced, and the Status. If the status is "Partial" or "Upload Failure". please contact your implementation manager. 


If the sync's status is "Successful Upload", please view the report and inform your implementation manager it is approved.


PPP


Create an SFTP folder for future uploads

To create an automated data sync process, we can set up a connection via SFTP.  

To Set up SFTP connection, contact your implementation manager and provide him with a source IP address or a range of addresses, and generate an RSA private and public key from your source environment and send us just the RSA public key. 

You can get this information from your company’s IT.  
 
Once all the information is provided, your SFTP folder will be created, the credentials will be shared with you. it can also be accessed at any point through the Integrations Settings:

title: HiBob API Integration
body:
HiBob API Integration user guide

1. Papaya Global’s API integration with HiBob allows users to sync HR data including basic salary information and PTO data from HiBob to Papaya.
The integration supports both HR and PTO data; users may choose if they want to integrate only one type of data or both.
This guide is the out of the box solution.
Important Note: In case you need customized fields or Data you wish to integrate but does not exist on HiBob (commission, benefits, and additional variables) you can use our HCM Cloud Connector.

 

HR Data Sync

PTO Sync

Worker service types

Payroll and Contractors workers

Payroll, Contractors and EOR workers

Initial sync

A full data snapshot for the first sync

The first PTO sync will retrieve data for the preceding 3 months

Sync schedule

Data from HiBob to Papaya will be synced daily with delta records only from the last run until today.

Data from HiBob to Papaya will be synced daily with delta records only from the last run until today.
Combined cycles (current and future) data will be synced. Future cycles (by themselves) will not be synced.

Worker status

"Active" and "Inactive"  workers

Only PTO records with an "Approved" status will be synced

Manual sync

Manual sync for troubleshooting with a full data snapshot can be requested from your CSM

Manual sync for troubleshooting with a full data snapshot can be requested from your CSM

 

2. Prerequisites for the integration setup
HiBob requires you to create an API Service User to configure your HiBob integration, this is needed so you do not have to use your personal HiBob account to connect. You can learn more about HiBob API here.
2.1. Create a Service user and token

  • Log into your HiBob account with the administrator user.
  • From the left menu, please select settings > integrations.
  • Select Automation.
  • Click the Service Users icon.

  • Enter a unique name and display name.
  • After adding these mandatory fields, please click 'Save' and the service user's ID and token will be displayed. 

You can learn more about creating a service user and token here. 
Important! Please make sure to copy the user token, Once you click done, there will be no way to see it again!
2.2. Create a permission group
Permission group allows you to specify what data you want the service user, and subsequently Papaya, to have access to. So, let's follow these steps:

  • Settings
  • From the left menu, select Settings --> Roles & Permissions
  • Add another group
    • i.e., Papaya service user group, this will allow you to find the group easily if you ever want to modify the data Papaya has access to.

  • In Select Who's on the Group, click select and add the Service user previously created in the Add Specific Employees and click Apply.

 


Important: The people in Select Who's in this group are those chosen for the permission group you are creating. By adding them to the group you are granting them access to the data you will configure in the next step.
2.3. Configure permissions for the permission group
To be fully operational with HiBob, Papaya needs the Permission group to have access to the permissions below. These can be set under People's Data --> Access Rights:


Important: By selecting people by condition you can filter out the employees that should not be pulled by the API. 


Make sure you mark all 23 subcategories in the view selected employees check boxes under the "People" section, from "About" until "Work Eligibility" and in order to get the FULL birthdate you would need EDIT permissions to the personal category



Make sure you mark the requests subcategory in the view selected employees check boxes under the "Time off" section.


2.4. Create a Custom Field to Map to Papaya Global's projects
A custom field is required for Papaya to associate employees with their projects.
A project in Papaya consists of 4 attributes:

  1. Site Location – Country
  2. Employee Service Type – Payroll, Contractor or EOR
  3. Pay Cycle – Monthly, Weekly, Semi-Monthly, Bi-Weekly
  4. Currency – USD/EUR/GBP…

e.g., Pragma Project 1 – Italy, Payroll, Monthly, EUR
Pragma Project 2 – UK, Payroll, Monthly, GBP
The custom field can be a pay group id, pay group name, legal entity ID or name, but it must reflect a 1:1 association to a project in Papaya.
In the initial setup of the integration, we will map your employees to the associated projects.
2.5. Populate Mandatory Fields in HiBob
To enable HiBob to communicate with Papaya and integrate HR and PTO data, some fields in HiBob must be populated for every Papaya Global employee in HiBob.
The following tables specify which fields are relevant to the Papaya integration, and which are mandatory and must be populated.

Employee Identification fields* Choose the nationality format according to the 4 options that are suggested here.  
Employee Contact Details Fields:

Employee Employment Status Fields:

Employee Job Information Fields:
Employee Compensation Fields:
Employee PTO Data Fields:
2.6. Roles and Permissions on the Papaya Global platform
To access the integration center for setup you must have one of the following roles with all three permissions. Talk with your CSM/GPE to make sure you are entitled to access the integration center.

PermissionsRoles
Customer AdminCustomer HR Manager
Integration Center View
Integration Center Edit
Integration Center HR



3. Configure Integration in Papaya Global
After configuring HiBob for API integration with Papaya, you can proceed to configure the integration on the Papaya Integration Center. For a detailed explanation on accessing the Papaya Integration Center, click here .
Note: Only these users can access, view, and use the Integration Center (IC): Customer Admin, Customer HR Manager, Customer Read Only User, users with Org Level Access.
To configure a HiBob API integration take the following steps:

  1. Log out of HiBob.
  2. Select integration & integration type.
  3. Connect to HiBob
  4. Apply mapping schema.
  5. Configure Auto-sync settings.
  6. View integration status

3.1. Log out of HiBob
To prevent SSO issues, log out of HiBob prior to logging into Papaya to initiate the integration process.
3.2, Select Integration & Integration Type
To initiate the HiBob API integration and begin the configuration process, click on HiBob Application in the Integration Center home page:

The Integration Details page will open, prompting you to select an integration type - HR or PTO. Click the Connect button next to the integration you wish to implement: HR or PTO

3.3. Connect to HiBob
Enter your HiBob User service ID and Token in the credentials dialog, then click Next.
3.4. Apply Field Mapping Schema
The application enables you to map source data from your HiBob system to target Papaya fields. You can create any number of schemas and apply them to additional connections. 
This section explains how to apply an existing schema as-is.
Following connection to HiBob, the Field Mapping page will open, displaying the default mapping schema:

Click the arrow next to the Mapping Names field and select schema from the drop-down list.
Make sure all lines are correct and have a green check mark, then click Connect & Continue
3.5. Configure Auto-Sync Settings
Once fields have been mapped and a connection established, configure Auto-Sync settings:
After setting Auto-Sync, click the Complete Integration button:
3.6. View Integration Status
Once you have completed configuring a PTO/HR integration, the integration center main page and the HiBob integration dialog will provide the relevant indication:
3.7. Adding Custom Fields
Custom fields can only be added when configuring HR data integration.
Enable editing for the schema where you want to add a custom field, open Custom Fields tab, then click Add Field: 
Map custom field/s to Papaya target fields:

Note: For any additional customization you may contact your CSM for assistance.

4. Mapping HiBob Integrations
4.1. Active/Draft Integrations
If you exit the integration wizard prior to completing integration by any means - closing the browser window, opening another Papaya page, etc. - your integration will be saved in Draft status, allowing you to complete the configuration process at any time:
4.2. Editing an Active Integration (Delete/Auto-Sync)
You can only disconnect or change Auto-Sync settings in an active integration.
To edit integrations, access the integration center as explained above, then set the Integrations toggle to My Integrations to display configured integrations.
My Integrations page displays Active Integrations (i.e., integrations that have been fully configured and are operational) and Draft Integrations (i.e., integrations that have been partially configured and are not yet operational).
Click on an active integration to open the integration dialog for editing:
Click on the context menu to Disconnect the connection, or Disable/Enable Auto-Sync:
4.3. Complete a Draft Integration
To complete a draft integration, access the integration center, then set the Integrations toggle to My Integrations to display configured integrations.
My Integrations page displays Active Integrations (i.e., integrations that have been fully configured and are operational) and Draft Integrations (i.e., integrations that have been partially configured and are not yet operational).
Click on a draft integration to complete to open the integration dialog, then click Complete Setup to return to the step in which you closed the integration wizard:

FAQs

  • Does HiBob integrate with Papaya Global's Payroll system?

    Yes, it does. The Papaya Integration Center allows companies to easily synchronize their third-party workforce data to the Papaya Platform. In doing so, users will save time, reduce the risk of errors, manage their data from a single source of record, never enter the same data twice, and ensure that all-important information is included in the Papaya Platform. Papaya’s API integration with HiBob allows users to sync payroll employee HR and PTO data from HiBob to Papaya. The integration supports both HR and PTO data; users may choose whether to integrate only HR or PTO data or both HR and PTO data.

  • What data can be synchronized between HiBob and Papaya Global

Anything that is supported by the HiBob API can be extracted, we currently consume HR and PTO data.
The list of fields from HiBob which are extracted into Papaya can be found in section 2.5, in this guide and is constantly updating.

If you have any special requirements that are not covered reach out to us at integrationsupport@papayaglobal.com

  • How does the integration between HiBob and Papaya Global work?

The integration between HiBob and Papaya is An API (Application Programming Interface) integration. It allows HiBob and Papaya to communicate and share data with each other.
The API integration enables the synchronization of relevant employee data between HiBob and Papaya. This data may include employee information (names, contact details, job titles, etc.), employment history, compensation details, and more.The API integration involves establishing secure communication channels between HiBob and Papaya platform. This involves using authentication protocols such as Service User ID and API Token to ensure that only authorized systems can access and exchange data.
To facilitate the data exchange, HiBob and the Papaya system would have defined a mapping mechanism. This mapping ensures that the data fields in both systems align correctly, allowing seamless and accurate transfer of information.

  • Are there any prerequisites or technical requirements for integrating HiBob and Papaya Global

Yes. The list of prerequisites can be found in section 2 in this guide.

  • What are the key benefits of integrating HiBob with Papaya Global?

When using more than one system it is hard to follow the updates and changes in all your systems. By integrating HiBob with Papaya, you know that all the information you update in HiBob is automatically updated in your Papaya platform. For example, HR staff might update an employee’s email address in HiBob, but this doesn’t update the email address where their payslip is sent, unless you have the integration.
 

  • Can employee data be automatically synced between HiBob and Papaya Global?

Yes. The data is automatically synced without the need of manual intervention.

  • How often does the sync occur? 

HR Data from HiBob to Papaya will be synced daily at 7AM GMT +1 with delta records only from the last run until today.             
PTO data sync will run on the Salary Cut-off date at 7AM GMT +1 with delta records from the last run until today.

  • Is there any additional cost associated with the integration?

    The out of the box API integration is free.
    If you have any special requirements that are not covered reach out to us at integrationsupport@papayaglobal.com.

  • Can HR managers choose the employees that get synced across to Papaya Global?

Yes, when creating a new permission group you can select people by condition and filter out the employees that should not be synced.

  • Is there an option for instant sync?

In some cases, for example a new employee has been added in HiBob that needs to have payroll set up asap, this can be done by the Papaya team. Contact your CSM/GPE and request an instant sync.

  • If I update information to the Papaya Global platform, does it sync back to HiBob?

    At this stage, the integration is a one-way sync only (HiBob to Papaya).

  • Need some help connecting my HiBob account and Papaya?

    We offer customers onboarding and set up as a part of our services, please reach out to us at integrationsupport@papayaglobal.com, one of our team members will be happy to book a setup session.

  • How do I get started?

If you’re interested in having Papaya and HiBob working together, contact your CSM/Global Payroll Expert to discuss the next steps.

title: Integration Center Guide
body:
About the Papaya Global Integration Center

What is the Integration Center?

Many Papaya Global customers have third-party systems managing employee and contractor data that they would like to integrate with the Papaya Platform.
 
Our Integration Center allows companies to easily synchronize their third-party workforce data to the Papaya Platform. In doing so, users will save time, reduce the risk of errors, manage their data from a single source of record, never enter the same data twice, and ensure that all important information is included in the Papaya Global Platform.
 

Data types that can be integrated into Papaya:

HR Data

  • HR Data: This encompasses personal data such as name, nationality, address, etc., and job-related information like cost center, job description, and other professional details. This comprehensive data set helps create a detailed employee profile, crucial for various HR functions. 

  • PTO Data: available for API integration (except for Namely). PTO import is limited to the current month only, meaning that the PTO end date cannot extend beyond the payroll period end date. For example, PTO leave from the 27th of April to the 5th of May, needs to be divided into two periods: April 27th to April 30th, and May 1st to May 5th. 

Compensation Data 

  • Cost Plan Data: Focuses on financial aspects such as salary structures, benefits, and fixed compensation elements, vital for accurate payroll management and financial planning. 

  • Variables (Salary Updates): This includes T&A (Time and Attendance), commissions, bonuses, expenses, etc. These elements represent the dynamic and variable aspects of compensation, essential for adapting to performance metrics and other situational changes in pay. 

Supported Integrations

The Papaya Global team is always adding new features and integrations to make your Papaya experience more effective and rewarding.
 
Currently supported integrations include:
 
 

Using the Papaya Global Integration Center

Accessing the Integration Center

Only Customer Admin users can access, view, and use the Integration Center (IC).
Once you have ascertained you have the appropriate permissions, log into your Papaya platform, then click Integrations:
 

Configuring New Integrations

To configure an integration, select one of the supported integrations, and click on it:
 
 
You can also use the Search box to find an integration by name (e.g. BambooHR, Expensify, OKTA, etc.):
 

Configuring BambooHR API Integration

For detailed instructions on implementing a BambooHR API integration with Papaya Global, please refer to the BambooHR & Papaya Global API Integration User Guide.

Configuring File Integration

File integration enables users to integrate information from any HRIS provider.
To configure an automatic sync of HR  data via file integration, click on the File Integration dialog, then click Contact Support to initiate a File Integration support request with Papaya Global.
 
 
 
For more information on the file transfer process, the required file format, etc. click here.

Configuring Expensify Integration

To configure an automatic sync of employee expenses data via integration with Expensify, click on the Expensify Integration dialog, then click Contact Support to initiate an Expensify Integration support request with Papaya Global.
 
 
For more information on the Expensify integration onboarding process, ongoing implementation, etc. click here

Configuring SSO Integration

To configure an integration of Papaya Global authentication with your SSO provider, click on the relevant SSO Provider dialog (Okta, OneLogin, Google). If you are using another SSO provider, click on the Use Another SSO App? dialog.
 
Once the relevant integration dialog opens, click Contact Support to initiate an SSO Integration support request with Papaya Global.
 
For more information on the SSO integration process, click here.
 

Managing Existing Integrations

Viewing & Editing Integrations

If you wish to view or edit existing integrations, set the Integrations toggle to My Integrations to display configured and draft-status integrations. 
 
In the My Integrations page, you will be able to view Active Integrations (i.e. integrations that have been fully configured and are operational) and Inactive Integrations (i.e. integrations that have been partially configured and are not yet operational).
 
Click on an integration dialog to edit:
 
 

Completing a Draft Integration

If you close the configuration wizard at any point in the process, the information you have entered will be saved in a Draft status, and the integration will appear in the My Integrations page, in the Inactive Integrations section. You can return to the draft at any point to complete the integration configuration process.
 
Click on an inactive integration to complete. You will be returned to the step in which you closed the integration wizard, and you will be able to complete and enable the integration:

Disconnecting an Integration

If you wish to disconnect an existing integrations, set the Integrations toggle to My Integrations to display configured and draft-status integrations.

Click on the integration you wish to disconnect:
 
  • BambooHR integration - Click the Disconnect link in the integration dialog
  • SSO integration - Click the Request Disconnection link in the integration dialog to send Papaya Support a disconnection request.
  • Expensify integration - Click the Request Disconnection link in the integration dialog to send Papaya Support a disconnection request.
  • File integration - Click the Request Disconnection link in the integration dialog to send Papaya Support a disconnection request.

title: Namely API Integration
body:
1. Papaya Global’s Out-of-the-box API Integration with Namely 

Papaya Global’s API integration with Namely allows users to sync HR data including basic salary information from Namely to Papaya.  

 

This guide is the out of the box solution. You can also see a video of the process. 

Important Note: In case you need customized fields or Data you wish to integrate but does not exist on Namely (commission, benefits, and additional variables) you can use our HCM Cloud Connector.




2. Prerequisites for the integration setup  

Namely requires you to Log into as an Administrator then click on API from the header dropdown. If you do not get the API link, please contact Namely for further assistance. 

2.1 Create New OAuth Application 

Click on New Application to create a new OAuth Application to connect to Papaya Global. 

Fill in the following parameters: 

Name: <Your Company Name> e.g., Acme LTD. 

Website: <Your Company Website> e.g., https://www.acme.com 

Redirect URI: https://service.papayaglobal.com/api/v1/integrationceter 

The redirect URI will be provided to you at the Papaya Global Integration Center once you choose the Namely integration setup wizard. Make sure you consume the right redirect URL from the Papaya platform. You will need the following roles and permissions as described here . 

2.2 Get Client Identifier and Client Secret Key 

Once you submit the new oath application you will receive 2 new parameters to connect your Namely application to Papaya Global platform: 

Client Identifier and Client Secret. 

Based on your client ID Client Secret and Sub Domain, we will be able to automatically generate a code for the API. 

e.g., SJstkWERTPS67zlTd2o9W9bGElpszMwG1PbFKZLGXXyqPPRA3DRzeIkFFFZ8F0Hc 

With this code we will pull the data from Namely directly to Papaya. 

Get the full instructions from the Namely website - Authentication 
 

2.3 Create a Custom Field to Map to Papaya Global’s Projects 

A custom field is required for Papaya to associate employees with their projects.  

A project in Papaya consists of 4 attributes: 

  1. Site Location – Country 

  1. Employee Service Type – Payroll, Contractor or EOR 

  1. Pay Cycle – Monthly, Weekly, Semi-Monthly, Bi-Weekly 

  1. Currency – USD/EUR/GBP… 

e.g., Pragma Project 1 – Italy, Payroll, Monthly, EUR 

Pragma Project 2 – UK, Payroll, Monthly, GBP 

The custom field can be a pay group id, pay group name, legal entity ID or name, but it must reflect a 1:1 association to a project in Papaya.  

In the initial setup of the integration, we will map your employees to the associated projects.



 

2.4 Populate Mandatory Fields in Namely 

To enable Namely to communicate with Papaya and integrate HR data, some fields in Namely must be populated for every Papaya Global employee in Namely. 
The following tables specify which fields are relevant to the Papaya integration, and which are mandatory and must be populated. 

Employee Identification Fields: 

Employee Contact Details Fields: 
Employee Employment Status Fields: 

Employee Job Information Fields: 

Employee Compensation Fields:

Employee PTO Data Fields:
Namely currently does not support PTO via REST API. There is an option to create a custom PTO report and we can pull it via the API




2.5 Roles and Permissions on the Papaya Global platform 

To access the integration center for setup you must have one of the following roles with all three permissions. Talk with your CSM/GPE to make sure you are entitled to access the integration center. 

3. Configuring Integration in Papaya Global 

After configuring Namely for API integration with Papaya, you can proceed to configure the integration on the Papaya Integration Center. For a detailed explanation on accessing the Papaya Integration Center, click here . 

Note: Only these users can access, view, and use the Integration Center (IC): Customer Admin, Customer HR Manager, Customer Read Only User, users with Org Level Access.

To configure a Namely API integration, take the following steps: 

  1. Log out of Namely. 

  1. Select integration & integration type. 

  1. Connect to Namely 

  1. Apply mapping schema. 

  1. Configure Auto-sync settings. 

  1. View integration status 

3.1 Log out of Namely 

To prevent SSO issues, log out of Namely prior to logging into Papaya to initiate the integration process. 

3.2 Select connection & connection Type 

To initiate the Namely API connection and begin the configuration process, click on Namely Application in the Integration page: 


The connection details page will open, prompting you to select an integration type - HR. Click the Connect button next to the HR Data 

3.3 Connect to Namely 

Copy the “Redirect URI” to your New OAuth Application at Namely, as described here . 

After the creation enter your Namely Client ID, Client Secret and sub domain in the credentials dialog, then click Authorize. 

3.4 API Authorization 

You will be asked to authorize access to Papaya Global. Click on “Allow” 

3.5 Apply Field Mapping Schema 

The application enables you to map source data from your Namely system to target Papaya fields. You can create any number of schemas and apply them to additional connections.  

This section explains how to apply an existing schema as-is.  

Following connection to Namely, the Field Mapping page will open, displaying the default mapping schema: 

Click the arrow next to the Mapping Names field and select schema from the drop-down list. 

Make sure all lines are correct and have a green check mark, then click Connect & Continue. 

3.6 Configure Auto-Sync Settings 

Once fields have been mapped and a connection established, configure Auto-Sync settings: 

After setting Auto-Sync, click the Complete Integration button and check that you are connected: 

3.7 View Integration Status 

Once you have completed configuring an HR integration, the integration center main page and the Namely integration dialog will provide the relevant indication:

3.8 Adding Custom Fields 

Custom fields can only be added when configuring HR data integration. 

Enable editing for the schema where you want to add a custom field, open Custom Fields tab, then click Add Field: 

Map custom field/s to Papaya target fields: 

Note: For any additional customization you may contact your CSM for assistance. 

5.  Managing Namely connections

5.1 Active/Draft connections

If you exit the connection wizard prior to completing the connection by any means - closing the browser window, opening another Papaya page, etc. - your connection will be saved in Draft status, allowing you to complete the configuration process at any time: 

5.2 Editing an Active Integration (Delete/Auto-Sync) 

You can only disconnect or change Auto-Sync settings in an active integration. 

To edit integrations, access the integration center as explained above, then set the Integrations toggle to My Integrations to display configured integrations. 

My Integrations page displays Active Integrations (i.e., integrations that have been fully configured and are operational) and Draft Integrations (i.e., integrations that have been partially configured and are not yet operational). 

Click on an active connection to open the integration dialog for editing: 

Click on the context menu to Disconnect the connection, or Disable/Enable Auto-Sync: 

5.3 Completing a Draft connection

To complete a draft connection, access the connectors hub, then set the connection toggle to My Integrations to display configured integrations. 

My Integrations page displays Active connections (i.e., connections that have been fully configured and are operational) and Draft connections (i.e., connections that have been partially configured and are not yet operational). 

Click on a draft connection you want  to complete to open the connection dialog, then click Complete Setup to return to the step in which you closed the connection wizard: 


 

 

  1. Integration FAQs 

Does Namely integrate with Papaya Global's payroll system? 

Yes, it does. The Papaya Integration Center allows companies to easily synchronize their third-party workforce data to the Papaya Platform. In doing so, users will save time, reduce the risk of errors, manage their data from a single source of record, never enter the same data twice, and ensure that all-important information is included in the Papaya Platform. Papaya’s API integration with Namely allows users to sync payroll employee HR data from Namely to Papaya. 

What data can be synchronized between Namely and Papaya Global? 

Anything that is supported by the Namely API can be extracted, we currently consume HR  data. 

The list of fields from Namely which are extracted into Papaya can be found here , and is constantly updating. 

If you have any special requirements that are not covered reach out to us at integrationsupport@papayaglobal.com 

How does the connection between Namely and Papaya Global work? 

The integration between Namely and Papaya is An API (Application Programming Interface) integration. It allows Namely and Papaya to communicate and share data with each other. 

The API integration enables the synchronization of relevant employee data between Namely and Papaya. This data may include employee information (names, contact details, job titles, etc.), employment history, compensation details, and more. The API integration involves establishing secure communication channels between Namely and Papaya platform. This involves using authentication protocols such as OAuth API application with client ID and client secret keys to ensure that only authorized systems can access and exchange data. 

To facilitate the data exchange, Namely and the Papaya system would have defined a mapping mechanism. This mapping ensures that the data fields in both systems align correctly, allowing seamless and accurate transfer of information. 

Are there any prerequisites or technical requirements for integrating Namely and Papaya Global? 

Yes. The list of prerequisites can be found here . 

What are the key benefits of connecting Namely with Papaya Global? 

When using more than one system it is hard to follow the updates and changes in all your systems. By integrating Namely with Papaya, you know that all the information you update in Namely is automatically updated in your Papaya platform. For example, HR staff might update an employee’s email address in Namely, but this doesn’t update the email address where their payslip is sent, unless you have the integration.  

Can employee data be automatically synced between Namely and Papaya Global? 

Yes. The data is automatically synced without the need of manual intervention.  

How often does the sync occur? 

HR Data from Namely to Papaya will be synced daily at 7AM GMT +1 with delta records only from the last run until today.  

Is there any additional cost associated with the connection?  

The out of the box API integration is free. 

If you have any special requirements that are not covered reach out to us at integrationsupport@papayaglobal.com. 

Is there an option for instant sync? 

In some cases, for example a new employee has been added in Namely that needs to have payroll set up asap, this can be done by the Papaya team. Contact your CSM/GPE and request an instant sync. 

If I update information to the Papaya Global platform, does it sync back into Namely? 

At this stage, the integration is a one-way sync only (Namely to Papaya). 

Need some help connecting my Namely account and Papaya? 

We offer customers onboarding and set up as a part of our services, please reach out to us at integrationsupport@papayaglobal.com, one of our team members will be happy to book a setup session. 

How do I get started? 

If you’re interested in having Papaya and Namely working together, contact your CSM/Global Payroll Expert to discuss the next steps.

Worker Integration Logic

This section outlines the logic used to determine which workers are integrated from your HRIS into our payroll platform.

  1. Eligibility Criteria - Workers must meet the following criteria to be eligible for integration:
    • Active or Recently Terminated Employment Status: Workers with an active employment status or those terminated within the last year are considered for integration.
    • Snapshot Date Relevance: We take a snapshot of the data relevant to the current date. Workers with data types that have future start dates will not be integrated until their effective date is reached.
    • Employment Groups: All employment groups are integrated by default. You can adjust the permissions of the integration to send only specific employment groups.
  1. EOR (Employer of Record) Workers
    • Creation and Cost Plan Updates: We do not enable the creation of EOR workers or the creation and updates to their cost plans.
    • HR Data and Salary Updates: For EOR workers, only the updating of HR data for existing workers and salary updates are enabled.
  1. Exclusion Criteria - Workers that meet any of the following conditions are excluded from integration: 
    •  Termination Date: Workers with a termination date that is in the previous fiscal year, unless they are sent in the first 3 months of the current fiscal year. 
    •  Adding Terminated workers to current cycle, needs to be handled by your local payroll team on the papaya platform
  1. migrating workers between projects - this use case is not automated in the integration process. local payroll administrator should open a ticket on papaya 360 to accommodate this need. after the migration process will be completed the integration for this worker will continue to update the data.
  2. Saving Cost Plan Data in the integration 
    • Cost Plan Data Rules 
      • Saved with the start date of the current open pay cycle. 
      • effective date should be populated in your HRIS if the update is retroactive. if the change is retroactive an automatic comment will appear in the Salary updates file to the ICP.
      • Each cost plan item requires an amount, number of instalments and currency. 
      • To close a certain cost plan item please set an end date to the pay component. 

Data Requirements for Salaried and Hourly Workers:

To ensure accurate payroll processing, it's important to understand the different data requirements for salaried and hourly workers.

  1. During the discovery step of the integration Data mapping, inform Papaya global which of the fields from your HRIS distinguish between salaried and hourly workers.
    • Salaried Workers: base amount, frequency, Currency, Annualization factor, effective date. 
    • Hourly Workers: Base amount for each hourly rate.

Please note: for hourly workers, each cycle, the total number of hours worked at each rate should be integrated to papaya. This can be done by uploading a file from your T&A platform or in the Salary updates section on the Papaya Global platform.

title: SAP SuccessFactors API Integration
body:
Papaya Global’s API integration with SAP SuccessFactors allows users to sync HR and PTO data including basic salary information from SAP to Papaya. This integration enhances payroll processing accuracy and efficiency by automating data transfer.

 

 

Prerequisites 

Integration Overview 
Authentication and Connection Setup 

Data Access and Permission Management 

Worker Integration Logic

Out of the box fields

Using the Integration

Data Imports Page

Updates and Maintenance

FAQ

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Prerequisites 

Before you start, ensure that you have Administrative Access: Full administrative privileges in both Papaya platform and SAP SuccessFactors. 

 

 

 

 

Integration Overview 

The integration process involves connecting Papaya platform with SAP SuccessFactors to synchronize key HR and PTO data fields. This synchronization is crucial for maintaining data consistency and accuracy in payroll processing. 

  1. Integration Mechanism 

    • SAML Authentication: Integration begins with Single Sign-On (SSO) authentication using the Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) protocol. This ensures that the exchange of data is conducted in a secure environment where the identity of the Papaya platform is verified by SAP SuccessFactors. 

    • API Protocol: Once authenticated, the Papaya platform utilizes SAP SuccessFactors' OData REST API for data transmission. The RESTful API design allows for a flexible, lightweight transfer of HR data in a structured format (such as JSON or XML), using standard HTTP methods like GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE. 
  1. Synchronization Options 

    • Scheduled Synchronization: The Papaya platform can be configured to automatically perform data synchronization daily, at regular intervals according to the project’s time zone.  

    • Manual Synchronization: For immediate data updates, the platform provides an on-demand sync feature. This allows administrators to manually initiate the synchronization process at any time, bypassing the scheduled intervals. 
  1. Data Transfer Process 

    • Secure Connection: SAML-based authentication confirms the identity of the Papaya platform to SAP SuccessFactors, establishing a trusted link. 

    • Data Exchange: Using the OData protocol, the relevant HR and PTO data is exchanged between the systems. The REST API's standard HTTP methods facilitate the creation, reading, updating, or deletion of records as needed. 

    • Confirmation: After the data exchange, the data is then updated and immediately reflected in the Papaya platform. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Authentication and Connection Setup 

  • Generate API Credentials: Follow the steps in the SAP SuccessFactors documentation to generate API credentials. SAP Documentation support page. 

  • Configure in Papaya Platform: Enter these credentials in the integration settings section of Papaya Platform. 
  1.  Starting the Integration Wizard 
    • Access the Papaya Platform: Log in and go to the Integrations page and select SAP SuccessFactors under the HRIS section.

    • Connect to HR Data Integration: Click the 'Connect' button to launch the integration wizard. 

    • Certification Data: Copy the certificate in the connection step of the wizard.

  1. Registering the Application in SAP SuccessFactors 
    • Navigate to the "Manage OAuth2 Client Applications" page within SAP SuccessFactors click "Register Client Application" to open the registration window. 

    • Certificate and Application Details: Paste the Papaya Certificate into the "*X.509 Certificate" field, set your application name and URL, and ensure the designated user has the necessary permissions. 

  1. Binding the User to the API 

    • Permissions Verification: Ensure the user you bind to the API has comprehensive permissions to access all necessary worker and data information. 

    • Application Registration: After entering all required details in SAP SuccessFactors, click "Register" to finalize the application registration. 

    • API Key Retrieval: Post-registration, click "View" in the resulting table to access and copy the API Key. 

  1. Configuring Papaya Integration Wizard 

    • Enter API Key: Return to the Papaya Integration Wizard and paste the copied API Key into the "API Key" field. 

    • Complete Required Fields: Fill in all remaining fields. These details are crucial for the successful integration of SAP SuccessFactors data with Papaya Platform. 

    • Save and Proceed: Click "Save and Next" to finalize the connection setup. This action saves your credentials and allows you to proceed to the next phase of the integration process. 

  1. Initial Data Mapping 

    • Mapping Overview: The mapping step is where you define how data from SAP SuccessFactors will correspond to fields within Papaya Platform. This ensures that the imported data is correctly organized and utilized. More on the mapping step can be found in section 6 of this guide. 

    • Optional Pause

      : If you're not ready to complete this step, click "Cancel" to exit. Your connection setup and credentials will be saved, allowing you to return and complete this step later. 

  1. Review and Testing 

    • Connection Confirmation: Once the initial mapping is defined, you should see a connection screen indicating that the setup is complete and ready for data synchronization. 

    • Data Synchronization Test: It's recommended to perform a test synchronization to ensure that data flows correctly from SAP SuccessFactors to Papaya Platform without any issues. 

  1. Final Steps 

    • Adjustments and Optimization: Based on the test results, you may need to adjust the mapping or connection settings for optimal data transfer. 

    • Integration Completion: With the successful test and adjustments made, your integration setup is complete. You're now ready to utilize the seamless data flow between SAP SuccessFactors and Papaya Platform for enhanced HRIS capabilities. 

 

 

 

 

Data Access and Permission Management 

For enhanced data security and compliance with privacy regulations, the Papaya platform allows you to control which worker data is synchronized with SAP SuccessFactors. This is achieved by binding a user to the API connection with permissions tailored to the entities you wish to transfer. 

  1. Setting Up Restricted Access 

    • Create a Dedicated Integration User: In SAP SuccessFactors, create a user account specifically for the integration. This account will be used solely for API interactions between SAP SuccessFactors and the Papaya platform. 

    • Assign Limited Permissions: Assign permissions to this integration user that correspond only to the data entities they need access to. This should include only the relevant employees for payroll processing by Papaya Global.  

    • Bind the User to the API Connection: Within the integration setup on SAP SuccessFactors, bind this user to the API connection. This ensures that any data requests made through the Papaya platform are carried out under the authority of this user, adhering to the set permissions. 

  1. Managing Permissions 

    • Review and Update Permissions Regularly: As your organizational structure or roles change, review and update the permissions of the integration user to reflect these changes. This ensures that only relevant data is accessible and synchronized. 

    • Audit Data Access: Periodically audit the data access logs to ensure that the integration user is only accessing the data within their permission scope. This practice helps maintain the integrity of your data security policies. 

  1. Data Synchronization with Restricted Access 

With the integration user in place and permissions defined, the data synchronization process will only include the worker data that the user is authorized to access. Here’s how it impacts the data flow: 

    • Filtering Data: When a synchronization request is made, either manually or through a scheduled sync, the API will only retrieve or affect data entities that the integration user has permissions for. 

    • Security Compliance: This method ensures that your integration complies with internal data security policies and external regulatory requirements by only exchanging permitted data. 

 

Worker Integration Logic

This section outlines the logic used to determine which workers are integrated from SuccessFactors into our payroll platform.

  1. Eligibility Criteria - Workers must meet the following criteria to be eligible for integration:

    • Active or Recently Terminated Employment Status: Workers with an active employment status or those terminated within the last year are considered for integration.

    • Snapshot Date Relevance: We take a snapshot of the data relevant to the current date. Workers with data types that have future start dates will not be integrated until their effective date is reached.

    • Employment Groups: All employment groups are integrated by default. Customers can adjust the permissions of the integration to send only specific employment groups if desired.

  1. EOR (Employer of Record) Workers

    • Creation and Cost Plan Updates: We do not enable the creation of EOR workers or the creation and updates to their cost plans.

    • HR Data and Salary Updates: For EOR workers, only the updating of HR data for existing workers and salary updates are enabled.

  1. Exclusion Criteria - Workers that meet any of the following conditions are excluded from integration: 

    •  Termination Date: Workers with a termination date that is in the previous fiscal year, unless they are sent in the first 3 months of the current fiscal year. 

  Adding Terminated workers to current cycle, needs to be handled by your local payroll team on the papaya platform

  1. Migrating workers between projects - this use case is not automated in the integration process. local payroll administrator should open a ticket on papaya 360 to accommodate this need. after the migration process will be completed the integration for this worker will continue to update the data.
  2. Saving Cost Plan Data in the integration 
    • Cost Plan Data Rules 
      • Saved with the start date of the current open pay cycle. 
      • effective date should be populated in SuccessFactors if the update is retroactive. if the change is retroactive an automatic comment will appear in the Salary updates file to the ICP.
      • Each cost plan item requires an amount, number of instalments and currency. 
      • To close a certain cost plan item please set an end date to the pay component. 

Data Requirements for Salaried and Hourly Workers:

To ensure accurate payroll processing, it's important to understand the different data requirements for salaried and hourly workers.

During the discovery step of the integration Data mapping, inform Papaya global which of the fields from SuccessFactors that distinguish between salaried and hourly workers.

    • Salaried Workers: base amount, frequency, Currency, Annualization factor, effective date. 
    • Hourly Workers: Base amount for each hourly rate.

Please note: for hourly workers, each cycle, the total number of hours worked at each rate should be integrated to papaya. This can be done by uploading a file from your T&A platform or in the Salary updates section on the Papaya Global platform.  

 

 

Out of the box fields

The following are detailed mappings of some key fields: 

    • Appendix A – HR Data from SAP SuccessFactors to Papaya Platform.

    • Appendix B – PTO Data from SAP SuccessFactors to Papaya Platform.

 

 

 

 

 

Using the Integration

After setting up the integration: 

    • HR Data Management: Sync employee details such as names, IDs, and job titles. The synchronization process can be monitored in the integration dashboard. 

    • PTO Data Management: Automatically update leave balances and track leave requests in real-time. 

 

 

 

 

Data Imports Page

After data synchronization between SAP SuccessFactors and the Papaya platform, it's essential to review the import results to ensure accuracy and completeness of the imported data. 

Accessing Import Results 

    • Navigate to the Data Imports section under the Integrations tab in the Papaya platform. 

    • Here, you will find a list of all data import activities, including both HR data and PTO data synchronizations. 

Understanding Import Status 

    • Successful Upload: The data was imported without any issues. 

    • Partial Upload: Some data was imported, but there may be errors or warnings that need attention. 

    • Failed Upload: The import did not complete, and no data was imported due to errors. 

Viewing Detailed Reports 

    • Click on a specific import entry to view detailed results. 

    • Within the detailed view, you'll find sections such as Total Entries, Processed, Invalid Data, and Joiners & Leavers. 

Validating Data 

    • The Validate Data area highlights any records with issues such as missing mandatory fields or invalid data. 
    • Errors must be addressed for the data to be correctly processed in future imports. 

Import Reports 

    • For a comprehensive review, download the full import report by clicking the Download Report File button. 

    • The report includes all entries, with detailed information on any data issues encountered during the import. 

Steps to Address Errors 

    • Review the text error descriptions provided in the report to understand the nature of the issues. 

    • For straightforward issues, you can often correct the data directly in SAP SuccessFactors. 

    • Re-attempt the import after making the necessary corrections to verify that the issues have been resolved. 

When to Contact Support 

Papaya Support 360 is available 24/7

    • If the error messages are unclear or you're unable to resolve the issues based on the descriptions provided, reach out to the Papaya support team for assistance.  

    • Provide specific details about the errors encountered and any steps you've already taken to try to resolve them. This will help the support team assist you more efficiently. 

    • For detailed support and assistance and for all integration-related inquiries

Best Practices 

    • Regularly monitor your imports to catch and correct issues promptly. 

    • Keep your field mappings up to date to prevent discrepancies between systems. 

 

 

 

 

Updates and Maintenance

  • Regularly check for and apply updates to both Papaya Platform and SAP SuccessFactors. 

  • Review integration reports periodically to identify and address any syncing issues. 

 

 

 

 

 

 FAQ

  • Q: How can I set up a new connection to SAP SuccessFactors?  

  • A: To set up a new connection, click the "Connect" button next to the respective HR Data or PTO section. You will be guided through a process to authenticate and establish a new connection with your SAP SuccessFactors account. 

  • Q: What does the 'Latest Sync' time indicate?

  • A: The 'Latest Sync' timestamp shows when the most recent data synchronization occurred between SAP SuccessFactors and our platform. It helps you verify that the data is current. 

  • Q: Can I manually initiate a data synchronization with SAP SuccessFactors?  

  • A: Yes, you can manually trigger a data sync by clicking the "Sync Now" option. This is useful if you've updated information in SAP SuccessFactors that you need to reflect immediately in our platform. 

  • Q: What does the 'Auto Sync' status mean?  

  • A: The 'Auto Sync' status indicates whether automatic data synchronization is enabled. If enabled, our platform will update data daily from SAP SuccessFactors without manual intervention. 

  • Q: What should I do if I want to change the fields that are being synchronized?  

  • A: To change the fields, click "Edit Field Mapping". From there, you can customize which data fields are mapped and synchronized between the two systems. 

  • Q: How can I view the current field mappings for my integration?  

  • A: You can review the existing field mappings by selecting "View Mapping". This will display the current configuration and data mappings between SAP SuccessFactors and our platform. 

  • Q: Is it possible to disconnect or remove an integration?  

  • A: If you need to disconnect or remove an integration, select the "Delete connection" option. Be cautious with this action, as it will stop all data synchronization activities for that connection. 

  • Q: Where can I find more help or support for SAP SuccessFactors integration issues?  

  • A: If you encounter any issues or need further assistance with your SAP SuccessFactors integration, please contact our support team by clicking the support link or reaching out through the provided contact options on our platform.  

  • Q: Can I disable auto-sync and if so, how?  

  • A: Yes, auto-sync can be disabled to stop automatic data updates. You can disable it by selecting "Disable Auto-Sync" from the options menu. This will turn off automatic synchronization until you choose to re-enable it. 

  • Q: Can we add additional Pay components in addition to Base salary to our data mapping?   

  • A: Yes. During the data mapping step its possible to customize the mapping and add additional Recurring pay components from SAP SuccessFactors. this can be updated at any time.

title: Why am I being charged for creating a Masked Card?
body:
If you use a credit card to buy Masked Cards, there will be a fee of $2 per card for all cards under $100. In addition, we’ll pass on a charge of 1.5% of the card value for cards above $100.

There are two important things to note about the fees:

  1. IronVest is NOT making money off these fees. We are simply passing along the fees we get charged, so that we may continue to provide you with Masked Cards.

  2. We have added a beta service option to link your bank account to IronVest available for Unlimited and Ultimate users. If you link your bank account, since we don't pay as much in fees, you will be able to continue creating Masked Cards without fees as part of your subscription price as long as you're using your Bank Account to fund the cards.

We’re not happy about having to pass on more fees to you – especially when they go to big profitable payment companies – so we’ll continue to look for better ways to process transactions for Masked Cards in the future. In the meantime, the convenience, privacy, and security of Masked Cards will now cost a few extra dollars unless you link your bank account to your account.

To link your bank account, make sure you have an Unlimited or Ultimate subscription and visit your Settings page.
